intro: Lucuma sambuensis, commonly known as the Andean starfruit, is a member of the Lauraceae family and is native to the high-altitude regions of the Peruvian Andes. It is characterized by its distinctive, elongated, yellow-orange fruit with a sweet, honey-like flavor. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and have a glossy, dark green appearance. The fruit is typically harvested when fully mature, and it is valued both for its taste and its traditional use in local cuisine.
